snippet: Lagardere, a key shareholder in EADS, the owner of Airbus, said it wanted to examine the deal announced Wednesday before giving its consent.
abstract: European governments and shareholders react with caution to news that European Aeronautic Defense and Space Co and BAE Systems, the region's two largest aerospace and military companies, are in advanced discussions to create a $49 billion behemoth; many analysts acknowledge the competitive advantages the merger could create, but worry the proposed ownership structure would be too complex.

byline.contributor: Mark Scott contributed reporting from London and Melissa Eddy from Berlin.

lead_paragraph: Lagardere, a key shareholder in EADS, the owner of Airbus, said it wanted to examine the deal announced Wednesday before giving its consent.

headline.main: Europe’s Governments and Investors Are Wary of a Giant Aerospace Merger
headline.print_headline: Europe’s Governments and Investors Are Wary of a Giant Aerospace Merger

keywords.value: European Aeronautic Defense and Space Co
keywords.name: organizations
